name: cucumber-cpp
description: Support for writing Cucumber step definitions in C++

repo.name: cucumber-cpp
repo.description: Support for writing Cucumber step definitions in C++

readme.summary: The README provides comprehensive dependency information and build instructions but lacks a cohesive quick-start path and clear explanations of configuration options.
readme.top_issue: No clear quick-start workflow - users must piece together dependencies, build steps, wire protocol setup, and Ruby integration from scattered sections without understanding the overall architecture upfront.

injection_risks.description: The 'listenArg' and 'portArg' are not validated for potential injection risks, although they seem to be used in a safe manner.
The 'protocolHandler->handle(request)' call may pose an injection risk if the 'request' is not properly sanitized, but it seems to be handled by the 'ProtocolHandler'.

critical_findings: Lack of validation for user inputs
security.summary: The code has some potential security concerns, including injection risks and lack of input validation, but overall it seems to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Lack of maintainer engagement and delayed responses
Stale releases - no v0.8.0 tag despite community requests
Feature gaps in tag regex and Windows QTestDriver support
Lack of guidance for integration scenarios (Makefile, Bazel, Qt)
sentiment.summary: The cucumber-cpp project shows clear signs of abandonment with unmaintained code, no recent releases despite requests, accumulated feature requests, and an explicit prior call for new maintainers that went unanswered.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are generally helpful and clear, showing patience with new contributors and a good level of technical depth.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite recent activity on 2026-01-07
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No merged pull requests in past 6 months
No closed issues in past 6 months
13 open issues with no resolution activity
Unknown last release date suggests stalled release cycle
positive_signals: Repository exists and has some historical activity
maintenance.summary: cucumber-cpp appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite open issues remaining unresolved.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized and appears comprehensive, but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and migration guides.

governance.summary: The project documents the decision process but lacks a succession plan and clear contributor ladder, posing medium risk due to potential bus factor issues.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and provides a good overview of the package, but lacks clear troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Few commits in the past six months (3)
Only one merged PR in the past six months
Docs: Lack of comprehensive troubleshooting section
Community: The mailing list is obsolete
Security: Potential injection risks in 'listenArg' and 'portArg'
Security: Lack of validation for user inputs
highlights: Two contributors have been active in the past six months
There are open issues and pull requests, indicating some level of community or user interest
